critique: The document is an execution order for the Lincoln assassination conspirators. As the President, I want to convey a sense of justice and resolution, but also somberness given the gravity of the situation. Joy is not an emotion I want to elicit, as this is a serious matter. Sadness is present due to the loss of Lincoln and the need for such harsh measures. Anger is directed at the conspirators, but I don't want to appear overly vengeful. Fear should be instilled in those who might consider similar actions. Disgust at the crime is definitely present. Surprise is not a primary emotion here, as the executions are a planned consequence.
